results.title: About your body. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part film using animation and the setting of a doctor’s surgery to discuss the skeletal, muscular, nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems of the human body. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: About time
results.creator_credit: Ed De Martin, Robert Marona and De Martin - Marona
results.brief_description: Presents the story of a girl and a tree she discovered as a child. Compares this relationship and the paradox of modern man caught in the time squeeze in order to point out the need for man to reorder his values concerning planet Earth.

results.title: About three hundred million years ago...
results.creator_credit: Jean Hunt, James Allen and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Shows geologists collecting data to make a geological map and the subsequent laboratory work required to identify the structure and composition of the samples collected. Once the information is compiled, the map can be drawn and ideas about the geological history of the area can be formed. Narrated by Sydney Conabere and photographed by Don Whitehurst. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: About The White bus
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, John Fletcher, Marlene Fletcher and Dateline Film Productions
results.brief_description: ‘The White bus’ was a dramatic film directed by Lindsay Anderson about a northern English town. John Fletcher, a friend and colleague of Anderson, has made a film about his friend at work, recording many private moments in the creation of the film; script, production, conferences, location work, editing, dubbing, music laying. An insight into the creative process of film production.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lindsay Anderson, John Fletcher, Marlene Fletcher and Dateline Film Productions

results.title: About the human body
results.brief_description: A young boy who goes to a doctor’s office for a physical examination is told about the more important body systems. Explains, using animation, the functions and uses of bones, ligaments and muscles, and demonstrates the working of the nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems.

results.title: About Supertext Subtitles (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This ten minute information video explains how deaf and hearing impaired can benefit from supertext subtitles on television programs, advertisements, videos and training films.

results.title: About sharks
results.brief_description: Notes the identifying characteristics and habits of a variety of sharks, such as the hammerhead and the carpet sharks; and shows their relationship with the smaller fish who clean them of parasites. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: About sex
results.creator_credit: Herman J. Engel and Texture Films
results.brief_description: Provides information to teenagers in a kind of rap session about sexual fantasies, body growth, homosexuality, V.D., masturbation and birth control. Suitable for school years 7-12.
